message_1: In how many ways can a committee of 3 people be chosen from a group of 8 people?
message_2:
To choose a committee of 3 people from a group of 8 people, we can use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of people (8 in this case), k is the number of people to choose (3 in this case), and ! denotes the factorial function (e.g., 5! = 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1).

So, in this case:

C(8, 3) = 8! / (3!(8-3)!)

C(8, 3) = 8! / (3!5!)

C(8, 3) = (8 × 7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1))

C(8, 3) = (8 × 7 × 6) / (3 × 2 × 1)

C(8, 3) = 336 / 6

C(8, 3) = 56

So, there are 56 ways to choose a committee of 3 people from a group of 8 people.
